frame.name: Departing
frame.definition:
<def-root>An object (the <fen>Theme</fen>) moves away from a <fen>Source</fen>. The <fen>Source</fen> may be expressed or it may be understood from context, but its existence is always implied by the departing word itself.
<ex><fex name="Theme">The plane</fex> <t>leaves</t> <fex name="Time">at seven</fex>.<fex name="Source">DNI</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Theme">His</fex> <t>departure</t> <fex name="Source">from the dock</fex> was delayed by hundreds of tearful farewells.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Theme">We all</fex> <t>exited</t> <fex name="Source">the room</fex> <fex name="Speed">slowly</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Theme
FE.definition: <def-root>This is the object which moves. It may be an entity which moves under its own power, but it need not be. <ex><fex name="Theme">The officer</fex> <t>left</t> the house.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Source
FE.definition: <def-root>All the verbs in this frame express some change of location, away from one place and to another. Any constituent that expresses the initial position of the <fen>Theme</fen>, before the change of location, is tagged with <fen>Source</fen>. Often the <fen>Source</fen> is understood from context. <ex>The woman <t>left</t>. <fex name="Source">DNI</fex></ex> <ex>The woman <t>left</t> <fex name="Source">the house</fex>.</ex><ex>We <t>departed</t> <fex name="Source">from New York</fex> on Friday.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Path
FE.definition: <def-root>Any description of the trajectory of the departure which is neither a <fen>Source</fen> nor a <fen>Goal</fen> expresses the frame element <fen>Path</fen>. In this frame, <fen>Path</fen> expressions almost always have a sense meaning 'via'. <ex>Spiderman <t>left</t> <fex name="Path">through the window</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Goal
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE labels any expression which tells where the <fen>Theme</fen> ends up, or would end up, as a result of departing from the <fen>Source</fen>. <ex>Our visitors <t>left</t> <fex name="Goal">for Los Angeles</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>Any expression which describes a property of motion which is not directly related to the trajectory of motion expresses the frame element <fen>Manner</fen>. Descriptions of steadiness, grace, and many other things count as <fen>Manner</fen> expressions, though <fen>Speed</fen> and <fen>Means</fen> should be tagged using the more specific FE labels. <ex>The messenger <t>left</t> the room <fex name="Manner">clumsily</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>The action of the <fen>Theme</fen> which results in its departure. <ex>He <t>retreated</t> from his opponent <fex name="Means">by taking a quick leap backwards</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Speed
FE.definition: <def-root>This frame element labels words or phrases that describe how quickly the <fen>Theme</fen> is moving. <ex>He <fex name="Speed">quickly</fex> <t>exited</t> the crowded terminal.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Mode_of_transportation
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Mode_of_transportation</fen> expresses how the motion of the <fen>Theme</fen> is effected, by its body or by a vehicle which holds and conveys the <fen>Theme</fen>. Vehicles can move in any way and in any medium.
In this frame, <fen>Mode_of_transportation</fen> is often expressed obliquely in a prepositional phrase headed by 'in' or 'by'.
<ex>We <t>set</t> <t>out</t> <fex name="Mode_of_transportation">by boat</fex> for Nova Scotia. </ex><ex>Wilbur <t>departed</t> <fex name="Mode_of_transportation">on foot</fex> for London.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Cotheme
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Cotheme</fen> is the second moving object, expressed as a prepositional phrase generally headed by 'with' or 'along with'. <ex>He <t>left</t> <fex name="Cotheme">along with John</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Distance
FE.definition: <def-root>The distance that the <fen>Theme</fen> has traveled. <ex>He <t>withdrew</t> <fex name="Distance">a little</fex> from her. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Time</fen> at which the departure takes place.<ex>We <t>left</t> <fex name="Time">in the morning</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Frequency
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Frequency</fen> is the rate at which each <fen>Theme</fen> departs.</def-root>

FE.name: Journey
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Journey</fen> is the trip or expedition on which the <fen>Theme</fen> embarks. <ex><fex name="Theme">Mr. Burns</fex> <t>departed</t> <fex name="Journey">on a hunting expedition</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Place</fen> is the location in which the departing takes place.</def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Depictive</fen> identifies a phrase which describes the <fen>Theme</fen> at the time of departing.</def-root>

FE.name: Reason
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Reason</fen> is the motivation or explanation for why the <fen>Theme</fen> departs.</def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Purpose</fen> for which the <fen>Theme</fen> departs from the <fen>Source</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Duration_of_end_state
FE.definition: <def-root>The length of time that the <fen>Theme</fen> stays away from the <fen>Source</fen> location.</def-root>

FE.name: Iteration
FE.definition: <def-root>The frame element Iteration is used for expressions that indicate the number of times an event or state (of the kind denoted by the target in its clause) has taken place or held.</def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition: <def-root>Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants.</def-root>

FE.name: Re_encoding
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE presents the current frame as an integral part of a larger conceptualization expressed by another frame. </def-root>

FE.name: Containing_event
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE denotes an event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at a time that includes the time during which the event or state of affairs reported by the target occurs and of which it is taken to be a part.
</def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. This often means that the Explanation causes the target's proposition, but not in all cases. </def-root>

FE.name: Event_description
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE describes of the state of affairs denoted by the Departing event as role fillers in other frames; the state of affairs reported Departing event is understood to play a role in the state of affairs of the modifier. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: depart.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: leave, especially in order to start a journey

lexUnit.name: disappearance.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the act of ceasing to be visible

lexUnit.name: escape.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: break free from confinement or control

lexUnit.name: skedaddle.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: (no obj. informal) depart quickly or hurriedly.

lexUnit.name: exit.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: go out of or leave a place.

lexUnit.name: set off.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: (support verb set) begin a journey.

lexUnit.name: emerge.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: come out (from a hidden position).

lexUnit.name: exodus.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a mass departure of people, especially emigrants.
